text: Mont-Saint-Michel is a municipality in the Laurentides region of Quebec, in Canada. It is part of the Antoine-Labelle Regional County Municipality. ==Demographics== Population change:Statistics Canada: 1996, 2001, 2006, 2011 census * Population in 2011: 633 (2006 to 2011 population change: 1.3%) * Population in 2006: 625 * Population in 2001: 619 * Population in 1996: 616 * Population in 1991: 647 Private houses where people live permanently (all the time): 266 (total houses: 422) Mother tongue: * English as first language: 0% * French as first language: 97.6% * English and French as first language: 0% * Other as first language: 2.4% ==References== Category:Settlements in Quebec
title: Mont-Saint-Michel, Quebec
